website_summaries.verdict: An excellent entry-level sewing machine for the beginner. It does the basics, but does them well. An affordable and highly dependable machine.
pros: This neat sewing machine is ideal for the beginner
It includes 12 stitch settings to choose from and a vertical oscillating hook bobbin
We love how easy this machine is to use
Includes all the sewing accessories you need to get started
cons: On some machines, the bobbin case can come loose after a few sessions

customer_reviews.title: I did NOT receive any accessories, not even a ...
customer_reviews.text: I did NOT receive any accessories, not even a screwdriver. I am not interested in running around trying to find parts for a brand new machine. Seriously.
customer_reviews.author: J A.

customer_reviews.title: No Needle Threader
customer_reviews.text: REALLY? THIS MACHINE HAS NO NEEDLE THREADER even though it is supposed have one. I’ve added a picture. I gave this as a Christmas gift, and it’s defective. Very upset that this machine doesn’t come as advertised!! !
customer_reviews.author: cypher203

customer_reviews.title: Really simple and easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: I fought for two hours with my two year old Brother electronic machine to get it to sew right. Searched on Amazon July 4th and came up with the Janome 2212 and ordered it that day.. Used a JC Penney machine for 35 years and it wore out, bought the Brother electronic machine. Hate it as I am an old timer. The new machine came today the 6th of July, read the book through, set it up and I just love it. So easy to thread, etc. Now I feel I can help my granddaughter learn to sew without having machine problems. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jacdandar

customer_reviews.title: What's with the bobbin?
customer_reviews.text: All in all this is a great machine for the price. Only downside I've come across is the bobbin system. Difficult to get the bobbin in and out. Had I tried out the machine before buying it, I would've kept looking. The breaks of buying online.
customer_reviews.author: Rockin' Robin

customer_reviews.title: Amazon “used” machine is useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought a “very good” used one from Amazon. The hook race unit wasn’t attached to the machine. I attached it according to the instructions. When I tried sewing, the feed dog adjacent to the hook race unit wasn’t working. The feed dog comes nowhere near the sewing plate. It can’t feed the cloth. It’s totally useless. I’ve applied for my refund. I’m returning it today. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Out of the Box Not Working
customer_reviews.text: I just took this out of the box and it does not work, when I press the foot pedal it "whirs" but nothing happens and I cannot figure out who to call through the Janome website.
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Missing extra  parts !  Not good !
customer_reviews.text: Did not get all the extras that were supposed to get . All I got were the needles and bobbins. Missing 3 feet, screw driver etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Noah.

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine! I've been sewing for almost 15 years now and I've half a dozen machines. I needed a reliable machine for college and all of my design related projects and this machine worked fabulously. The tension is great. The foot stays firm while sewing to make those perfect stitching lines. I've had this machine for over a year now and it's still holding up great! 10/10!
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect light sewing machine.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this new sewing machine and it was so easy to set up, thread the machine and thread the bobbins! It came nicely packaged in foam, the owners manual is great because it helps you with step by step instructions with illustrations. Would highly recommend for beginner to expert. Very happy with this machine! Also it is very light, easy to carry, and comes with a plastic cover for storage. Comes with extra bobbins, needles, and fabric guides etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amber C.

customer_reviews.title: Defective. Too late to return.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine in 2018. Set it up for the first time today 2020_April_26. The tension is totally messed up. I have done a lot of sewing in my life and know how to adjust tension, but when the highest tension setting didn't resolve the problem I started working on the bobbin tension. No luck yet. Taking it to a repair shop once the restrictions are lifted. I will buy another machine locally in the meantime. Once repaired I will give this one away.
customer_reviews.author: V. Gungor

customer_reviews.title: Missing the bonus Bundle
customer_reviews.text: I received 2 of these and both were missing the bonus bundle. I’ll try one more time but from a different vendor.
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Best first machine!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine 7 years ago. I know I’m supposed to, but I never had it cleaned, oiled, or serviced in any way. I recently had a lot of sewing projects come up so I purchased this same model again as a backup because I knew I wouldn’t have time to be without my machine. It is still in the box. My old machine is going strong. This is a great model for any beginner. There aren’t a lot of fancy features, but even 7 years in, I haven’t needed to do anything this machine can’t do. Can’t beat the price either!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love my sewing machine I have made masks and seat belt covers. Still learning since it’s been over 20 yrs the last time I used one. Price was just right.
customer_reviews.author: Lilbit’s Creations

customer_reviews.title: Free motion quilting
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time to try free motion quilting. This machine isn't very expensive and I wondered if it would be adequate for quilting. I only wanted to do lap quilts or bags. I love it! Inexpensive and for regular sewing it is so much better than my Singer. I thought it would come with the quilting feet but it did not. However I ordered a 3 foot set for under $8. It was worth the delay before I could learn to free motion quilt.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful Machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not big on writing reviews but I had to make a moment to do so...As a novice sewer, this machine will have your comfort level at "Hello". From loading the bobber, to threading, to stitch selection and variable foot control speed, this machine is virtually plug and play. I can't believe how affordable it is because the build quality and superior performance screams expensive! I was fortunate to buy the last one before they sold out last week and SO glad I got it!!!
customer_reviews.author: feminist_connect

customer_reviews.title: The newest best.
customer_reviews.text: My mom bought me a Singer sewing machine for my birthday when I was in college (Textile design and yes I am a guy). I hauled that Singer around for 27 years. My wife and my mom made her wedding dress and my wedding shirt on it. It made puppets, patched sails and took care of .................................................. Then it died. I bought a new Singer (it was SAD) and four other brands before purchasing this unit. Yesterday I repaired a seam rip in the jib. Its simple, easy to string and I have probably put about 30 hours on it without problem. I think it is GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Glad I returned Brother and bought Jenome
customer_reviews.text: As an occasional user of sewing machines, I first bought a Brother because of its sterling reputation, but it turned out a big disappointment as a bird nest keeps forming. Although returning a machine is quite a hassle, I took the trouble and returned it before too late. Never heard of Jenome as a brand, yet based on its good reviews, I took a chance, and was rewarded nicely. Not a problem ever happened since the purchase. Glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: XML

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine gets jammed easily, and I'm constantly having to disassemble the lower bobbin area to un-jam. Also pressure foot feels cheap and doesn't control easily, feels like it either goes snail speed or 100mph. Stitch length is never consistent.
customer_reviews.author: A.Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Quality machine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't touched a sewing machine since a half-semester long home-ec class in 7th grade some 30-ish years ago, and I don't remember a thing about it. This machine is great for a beginner like me. It is simple to operate and appears to be built to last a lifetime. The printed instruction manual is clear and easy to read. The evening it arrived I read the manual and was sewing very soon after. I've only used it on one project so far, but it has exceeded my expectations. I like that it came with some useful accessories such as the zipper foot and thread ripper.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.text: Sewed one short seam and then it stopped. I did routine troubleshooting, nothing helped. Wheel does not turn. Needle does not go down. Locked up. I’m an experienced seamstress. Way too late to send back. COVID has closed all my available
customer_reviews.author: cactus

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine because, I saw a review on YouTube from Crafty Gemini and she went though all the basics with this machine and it really beginner friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: A dream machine!
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine is so easy to use and I can carry it with one arm. I only do light sewing and it has been my favorite so far. I sold two other machines in a yard sale because they were to complicated. This little machine makes me want more projects. I no longer dread the bobbin or threading the machine. If ever I need another sewing machine, I will definitely buy Janome.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who are new to sewing
customer_reviews.text: Started working for a fabric company and was recommended to this sewing machine. Not much of a learning curve. Easy to use and easy to find videos on youtube on how to use. Would recommend to anyone who is new to sewing or just wants a simple and straightforward machine that can fulfill their sewing needs! I've had mine for 4 years now
customer_reviews.author: Joy Cho

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to replace the Singer 3232 (which I also reviewed) and I have been delighted with the purchase. I don't do any fancy sewing -- straight stitch, the occasional zig-zag or button-hole -- and this machine hums along beautifully. Controls are even more convenient to reach and use than on the old Kenmore that was my stand-by for years and years. I would recommend this machine to beginners or old hands who need a simple machine for day-to-day use.
customer_reviews.author: William M

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Great machine!!
customer_reviews.text: After having purchased 4 inexpensive ($100ish) Singers over the last few years which were throwaways (ouch!) I went with others' reviews on this model & pulled the trigger on a brand I'd never heard of. YAY. This unit is superb. I immediately re-upholstered a couch and made 2 cushions and several throw pillows, no muss no fuss! This thing is wonderful. Easy and dependable! UPDATE: To clean the lint out of the throat plate (the part under the presser foot) get one of these:
customer_reviews.author: colleenesh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time purchasing a Janome machine and I must say, for a cheap small machine it does an outstanding job in sewing. I don't need to spend a lot of money on another machine again. I spent $1200 on machines and will never do that again. This little machine does all the necessary work that I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes007

customer_reviews.title: I am happy to report that the Janome 2212 has met all ...
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to report that the Janome 2212 has met all my expectations. This is the ideal machine for a beginner or for someone returning to sewing, like myself. You can certainly buy another brand for half the cost that has twice the number of stitches and features, but they have to skimp somewhere. The Janome is built very well and will, more than likely, last a long time. When you are not the best sewist, a machine that is constantly breaking down will discourage you from sticking with it. This machine makes sewing quite enjoyable because every feature on it works well and makes learning fun.
customer_reviews.author: SAS

customer_reviews.title: Good basic machine; buy other needles
customer_reviews.text: This machine has performed fairly well-a good basic machine. I initially had a lot of problems with tension and breaking needles. I thought I should stick with Janome needles, but another Amazon reviewer pointed me to the Schmetz brand, and they have made a huge difference. I also needed to buy a basic zig-zag presser foot, as the original broke as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon woman

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this machine for a few days, but I love it. I got tired of trying to lug my heavy Elna to my quilt class twice a month, and had bought the Hello Kitty version for my granddaughter. After using her machine for a couple of weeks, I researched buying one for my self. I took it to the group the other day and it did exactly was it was supposed to do. It's a basic machine, but that's all I need most of the time. Its not as lightweight as Hello Kitty but much lighter than the Elma, which I have had for about 17 years and also love.
customer_reviews.author: NHQuilter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastico!
customer_reviews.text: Sewing your own clothes is one the best inventions since biblical times. I am so happy with this sewing machine. It works so smoothly. Yes, it has cheap like plastic parts, but it's very user friendly. I have sew possibly one hundred things by now. It has the capability to embroider as well if you are daring enough. Here the greatest part: besides warranty, it can take almost any generic foot and work just as well as the name brand part. God bless you guys!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Workmanlike, inexpensive, and has some heft
customer_reviews.text: I have two Bernina 1000 machines which I love, but needed an entry level for a family member out of town. This was a great price and feels like a more expensive machine. It isn't too light or flimsy, it has some gravitas and stays where you put it. It was easy for a non-sewer to learn on and fairly easy to move around and store. Excellent choice for a modestly priced, general purpose sewing machine. We made pillows (including with fairly heavy wool knit), curtains, and napkins, all with good results. We didn't try it on machine quilting with the feed dogs dropped, so cannot opine on how it would be for that.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems good for now. I'm just having trouble getting the presser foot to loosen the grip on the fabric. The light fabric keeps getting jammed. I think it's just user/ beginner error. I'll keep working at it.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelylady

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T GO WRONG BUYING THIS MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: I have very little sewing experience due to a few machines and got frustrated trying to use them. I purchased this machine and it is easy to thread, quiet, and well made. I love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Harveston

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this sewing machine. I started with a Singer Simplicity and threading the needed was so daunting that by the time I got it figured out I would get bored and put the machine away. I had it for 15 years and only used it a hand full of times. This machine, although basic is extremely user friendly and fun. I am now teaching my 5 year old how to use it (with my help) and she loves it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Vrooooom

customer_reviews.title: janome sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: as a beginner in quilting this machine fits my simple needs at sewing patch work. its light and easy to carry
customer_reviews.author: ela

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: I have some sewing experience but it has been many years. This machine was easy to figure out, has nice features. It is also reasonable priced! It is perfect for my use!
customer_reviews.author: foxglove

customer_reviews.title: Janome Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: Was constantly having issues with my previous brand new Singer machine (tension on upper thread or bobbin thread), wads of thread coming out of the bibbin end. Even after having it adjusted at a repair shop (which cost almost as much as the mahine!). It worked until I changed to a different thread color and then started breaking the thread from the top spool -- what a pain!!!!! This Janome has worked perfectly right out of the box!!! Easy to thread, both upper and bobbin, plus the manual actually makes sense, which was greatly lacking with my Singer machine and manual. For simple, practical sewing, you can't go wrong with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: ritaj

customer_reviews.title: Janome sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: My 37 year Janome needed Rest and rehab. What else would I purchase? The updates are easy to learn, stitches are precise, & a companion to it’s older sister.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Janome 2212
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basic machine. It has all the stiches I will need. Easy to set up and thread. A perfect machine for anyone who needs a good machine! I didn't want the computerized machines and this is perfect for me. It comes with a set of needles and a few presser feet. Does not come with a walking foot, which I was hoping it would. It's a low shank machine with snap on presser feet---so finding feet that fit should not be a problem. I like the vertical bobbin too. I don't like the cheap plastic of some machines. It does everything I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Michaels

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE my new sewing machine. I do minor repairs, hem when needed, and learning to quilt. I can sew thick and thin material. I needed a light weight high quality machine. I move a lot overseas and this product is going with me everywhere I am stationed. This is a great product and I highly recommend it for anyone who needs a simple machine to operate. One of these days I will learn to use all the many other features it offers!
customer_reviews.author: L&N

customer_reviews.title: Took it out of the box, plugged it in, threaded it and it was ready to go.
customer_reviews.text: I have written very few reviews but wanted people to know this machine is wonderful. I had an old Kenmore and it died. When I did a little research I found out it was made by Janome. I think I had the Kenmore(Janome) for close to 30 years. Great product. I've been using the new one to make masks and a small quilt. Purrs like a kitten.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Martin

customer_reviews.title: Just starting to use...good first impression
customer_reviews.text: Although I'd never heard of this brand, after reading the reviews, I thought, "Why not?" Then, I talked to my friend who is a professional seamstress. She owns three Janome machines. The machine's major features (threading, bobbin-loading, etc.) are like those for my Husky and Singer. I ordered this to use at my winter residence. Perhaps I'll be persuaded to buy another to replace my home machine.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa McCord

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed 😞
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy it again, this stupid thing does mended, etc jeans, quilt and a whole lot of other things. If it would be nice if I could exchange it but now I have to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Gray

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended to buy
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't easy to set up. Vibrates when in use. Not very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these as gifts for my daughters, They have never sewed before and I wanted just a basic machine. While I haven't used the machine very much yet I was happy with the machines performance. Threading is nicely numbered which is good for a novice sewer. Tension was easy to adjust. The machine sewed through some heavier material without any difficulty. Overall I'm very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: inga kerns

customer_reviews.title: Love this little work horse
customer_reviews.text: So much lighter than the older model machine I had. This machine makes a great stitch and is quite. It is easy to use and takes little store space. Great size for my use and it would be great to take to sewing circles or classes! Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: J Ingram

customer_reviews.title: I am assuming this machine was fine as I have not heard any comments about it
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to my 3 granddaughters in the State of Indiana and I am in Florida. I am assuming this machine was fine as I have not heard any comments about it. I do not believe they have used it yet. I have owned 4 Janome sewing machines and have been satisfied with all except 2 of them had the reverse button quit and this was unfixable I was informed. Maybe the manufacturer could work on this so it will not occur in other machines. I would not have purchased a Janome if I had not thought it dependable so I have rated it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn j. cole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect machine for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This machine was just what I was looking for! I own a computerized Janome Memory Craft 6500, but wasn't comfortable using the fancy machine on craft projects, or projects that are a little more rough and rugged. I didn't want to spend a lot for a back up machine, and I was very pleased to find that Janome offered this simple, basic, sturdy machine at a great price. It is small and lightweight, but sews through thick craft materials without any problems. I am very pleased and would recommend this machine to beginning as well as experienced sewers. Thanks Janome!
customer_reviews.author: LMost

customer_reviews.title: Great budget sewing machine.
customer_reviews.text: Great sewing machine for those on a budget. Lots of stitches and very easy to operate. I love the Janome brand. I make costumes for the stage...often sewing various textures and styles of fabrics. This machine handles them all without issue. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this sewing machine. Janome is a wonderful brand, definitely a million times better than Brother. It even comes with spare needles, I broke my needle last night and it was easy to replace it and keep going. My only complaint is that the foot pressure is a bit too light and is not adjustable, which makes it hard to sew tough materials like faux fur. But other than that it is great. I use it for making costumes.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have not used it much yet
customer_reviews.text: I have just made a few cat toys so far, but it has not given me any trouble. It runs smoothly, tension adjusts easily. I do wish the cord was longer as it barely makes it behind the desk and forward to my foot. Winding bobbins is easy as is threading the machine.
customer_reviews.author: A. McCumber

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a starter machine and I love it so far. I am new to sewing and only have done basic things on this machine so far. However, I have been using it for about 6 months and have had no issues. The machine is easy to setup and I have found the daily use to be super simple. I do basic quilting and sewing and I can't think of anything that I will want to do in coming years that this machine is not able to do. I highly recommend this machine for beginners.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent beginner machine that will take me into the next levels.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to learn to sew on this machine and the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: AngelaNOLA

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! It's very straight forward and so easy to use. No complicating buttons, or crazy stitches I would never use. This machine is more than your basic machine but it's so user friendly it's great! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Redhead

customer_reviews.title: Solid sewing machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: My first Janome sewing machine. I had used a Singer for 20 years and needed replacement. Easy to use and surprised how quickly Bobbin winding is!! Feels like a solid machine , have using for 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Swim Mom

customer_reviews.title: In love with this machine and it is easy to use for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: I retaught myslef how to use the sewing machine. It is a wonderful machine for beginners. Easy to use and instructions are easy to follow. I also used youtube videos to help demomstrate along with reading the instructions. I have this machine for a month now and have hemed few pair of jeans and make pillow covers. The needle and presser foot go well through sewing the thick part of jeans for when heming. I love this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Blueberry head

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kenmore for 50 years. I thought I deserved a new machine!! I am an artist and wanted to do free motion stitching with the machine. I did my research and the Janome 2212 advertised that it would do this, plus it was low in price, was not digital and it was highly rated as a well made machine. It far exceeded my expectations as it does more than I imagined!! I am very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: diane banks

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I am not a beginner but I'm not a pro either lol. This machine is light weight but sturdy with the perfect amount of features. It did not come with a threader but it was not an issue for me. I'm satisfied as long as it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: arturo j./ KRISTEN

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner machine. Easy to thread, nice pedal, great directions and bonus, NOT made in china
customer_reviews.author: suzanne r brennis

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. I had to look up y-tube for some instructions but it’s been a long time since I used a sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Herndon

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Made some curtains, and the sewing was easy. No problems. Bobbin was easy to wind, and the machine seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: a reader

customer_reviews.title: Love it.. great sewing machine for beginers
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my daughter to learn stitching and she finds it easy to use and loves it. It does have other features like stretch and button hole maker which we have yet to try. She has been using it for almost a year with no issues. Overall a great machine. I will recommend it to all.
customer_reviews.author: Rashida Furniturewalla

customer_reviews.title: One of the BEST purchases I've made while on lockdown
customer_reviews.text: The last time I used a sewing machine was in home economics. Super easy to use and the machine is very smooth. Quick delivery and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Tephly

customer_reviews.title: Great value! Excellent machine!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use! Well built machine, should last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Non-Computerized Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Great all-purpose little sewing machine. It's easy to thread and maintain and it even does a few more advanced jobs like automatic buttonholes. You might not even need the manual if you've had basic knowledge of other machines since most things are pretty self-explanatory.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginner & Intermediate sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Well made machine, I got it on Friday and then spent all day sewing a toddler dress on Saturday. The instructions and troubleshooting are clear and make it easy to understand what stitch to use and when. I would absolutely use this machine again
customer_reviews.author: Faith Eastling

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Janome over the last 20 years.Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Cates

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with the "feed dog" not working
customer_reviews.text: I am new to sewing but learned quickly how to use this machine. However, it would take me some time before I realized it had not been working properly. The "feed dog" was not working at all. The manufacturing of this part is not right and now must return the item.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This machine does exactly what I need. I wish it had a wider extended table
customer_reviews.author: Ellen L. Stock

customer_reviews.title: Sewing Mast
customer_reviews.text: Like Product, but was send Two of them. I returned one to Health and Kitchens, 26 West Chatham Ct. Ga. 31408. The Tracting No.1z4r77890390161235 by Ups. Drop off date Monday May the 4, 2020. Was charged on a Barclay Bankcard , Jeffrey Hart 1056 County Club dr. Zanesville Ohio 43701 Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey hart

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: I like a straightforward machine and this is it! Perfect for all kinds of tasks from mending to long seam stitching to creative projects. Threading is a breeze, as is bobbin winding. I've had it for a month and have already put it through some significant wear. It's easy to use and always ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: pamaina

customer_reviews.title: No issues!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for a while now and have yet to run into any problems. I've been using it a lot lately for alterations and it works wonderfully. I recommend this machine for anyone starting out sewing as I am- it's very easy to work with and as I said, I have yet to experience any bobbin problems, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mbarcellona

customer_reviews.title: Good machine!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the beginner sewer. You can’t go wrong with a Janome!
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2many

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy for this Novice!  Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am a novice at sewing, but this machine made me feel like I knew what I was doing right from the get-go. Easy to wind the bobbin, easy to thread, then push the foot petal and away you go!
customer_reviews.author: Spenda Buck

customer_reviews.title: Good solid machine for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Love the machine. I am a begging sewer who has not sewed it years. It was easy to set up once I understood how to put the front loading bobbin in! It makes a "q" instead of a "p" with the thread. Tension is always good at 4. Glad I bought this one.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon11

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the sewing machine with the bonus bundle and only received the plastic bobbins and needles. Everything else is missing. Will not be ordering anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Gadieliz

customer_reviews.title: just a few wants lacking
customer_reviews.text: thread spool not big enough to hold large spools of thread and wish the bobbin could be looked at without taking it out of the case (so you can see how much thread is left on it) My Brother I could always tell if I needed to replace the bobbin before it ran out.
customer_reviews.author: maz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i wanted a cheap easy to use machine
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i wanted a cheap easy to use machine. I'm a beginner and just make pretty easy stuff. Dog coats, pillow cases, curtains, hemming pants ect. No major quilts or anything so it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Bobbin winding not working. Faulty?!!!!
customer_reviews.text: unable to wind the bobbin using foot control. I followed all the steps but it seems the bobble winder does not spin when I depress the foot control. Faulty?!!!
customer_reviews.author: rachel huang

customer_reviews.title: works great for part time seamstresses
customer_reviews.text: I use it to make lap quilts for my 24 grandchildren... Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: M Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this machine and has several projects planned for it. Great machine at a very good price. Very sturdy, runs smoothly, and much more quietly than her old Brother machine.
customer_reviews.author: John55

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 50 year old machine so some of the features were new to me.The basic design is the same as the old one, but I still had to learn how it works. So far I like it. It does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: but does do repair jobs easily.
customer_reviews.text: It was quite a bit smaller than expected, but does do repair jobs easily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda B.

customer_reviews.title: A Janome Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple inexpensive machine. It does not do anything fancy, but the price was right. I have used it only once, and it works for my needs. I wish it had a carrying case and a container for the few attachments. It is easy to thread.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara A. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: I returned the Janome 2212 immediately. Thank you Amazon ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned the Janome 2212 immediately. Thank you Amazon for the quick refund. The problem was the feed dog was not set properly so the fabric would not advance. It should be a simple adjustment but no live person could be reached at the Janome call number. I bought another Janome at an independent dealer where my questions will be answered directly. I would rate the Janome help a Minus star.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Dodds

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Great machine especially for the money. The more expensive ones you're just paying for all the gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: kp4

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 5 of these machines for a startup sewing school in my home for beginner sewing classes. These machines work like a charm! I love the ease of use and they are sturdy. I will purchase additional machines as my school grows, but for now these are high on my recommendation list for students.
customer_reviews.author: ksands

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, reminds me of the sewing machine I learned to sew on 50 years ago. No complicated choices or digital readouts to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, quality product
customer_reviews.text: Amazon always takes care of this. Bought it due to high ratings from others, and am very happy with the performance even sews jeans without a problem. Was nervous since it was so lightweight compared to our old Singer. Used it several times and has held up without hesitation and seems higher quality than our last machine.
customer_reviews.author: j. gross

customer_reviews.title: It is the perfect portable...I use it all the time when I am at Bee's or group sewing
customer_reviews.text: Makes a nice stitch...uses my Kenmore feet which is convenient
customer_reviews.author: dee ann havely

customer_reviews.title: Remembering what I enjoy!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use for beginner's ,but doesn't disappoint a skilled person. The set stitches are perfect for a seasoned professional. I approve of this product 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Balof-Bird

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Machine for the Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife for her first sewing machine, and we were both impressed with the quality of the machine for the money - we looked at some other brands in stores, and others in this price range seemed much flimsier. My wife, who is new to sewing, was able to do the set-up quickly and correctly her first try, and hasn't complained once.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great First Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my first sewing machine and I love it so far. I've had it almost a month now, and have completed several small piecing and quilting projects (baby blanket and throw size). If you're looking for additional feet I recommend the "15 pc Sewing Machine Presser/Walking Feet Kit" from Amazon which includes a walking foot and a 1/4" foot for quilting. I didn't care for the darning foot included in the 15 piece set; however, I was able to find another generic low shank foot at a local fabric store that works well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Stancil

customer_reviews.title: great machine
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this very simple to use machine! Two questions: Anyone have trouble with material getting caught in the feed dog when starting right on the fabric edge (with needle in fabric), and what about the one sided zipper foot that does not switch from left to right? Am I just outdated? Could be!
customer_reviews.author: nutmeg

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple machine
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to do much with this yet, as I bought it for my son. He was able to get it started on his own (10 yr old) and enjoys working with it. So far, we're impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is the best machine I have ever had and I've been sewing for 60 years.
customer_reviews.author: kitty

customer_reviews.title: nice machine for the money
customer_reviews.text: Having a difficult with the tension. does not sew layers well even light weight cotton turned to hold ear loops on masks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like butter!
customer_reviews.text: This review is going to sound like a fake, but I LOVE this machine. Out of the box and 10 minutes of set up, it runs like butter! I was able to sew four pairs of pant hems within the same time as my old machine took to thread and adjust the tension. I am really pleased. I am a casual sewer--hems, scout patches, darning. I just need a light, portable machine which is easy to sit down and get going. The fabric feed glides smoothly and the bobbin wider is straight forward. Really a nice machine for a casual sewer.
customer_reviews.author: BeckyFS

customer_reviews.title: Exciting Christmas gift.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 14 year old granddaughter for Christmas. After looking up the video on the internet, she figured how to get the bobbin in and machine working. Would be nice to include a video with the machine. Her dad found one on the internet. She is thrilled with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This machine is quick out of the box and to work. The easy set up and workability of this simple, yet mighty sewing machine is beyond compare. You will enjoy many years of great sewing with this. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.rhetta

product_meta.title: Janome 2212 Sewing Machine
product_meta.description: Style Name:Janome 2212 Sewing Machine2212 Features: -Front loading bobbin and free arm. -Speeds up to 1000 spm dial pattern selector. -Manual tension control. -Snap-on presser feet,built-in thread cutter. -12 Stitches, 4 step button hole. -Stitch length adjustment to 4mm,0-2.5 stitch length for reverse stitch. Product Type: -Mechanical sewing machine. Light Included: -Yes. Free Arm: -Yes. Needle Threading System: -Manual. Reverse Stitching: -Yes. Automatic Bobbin Winding: -Yes. Thread Tension Adjustment: -Yes. Thread Tension Adjustment Type: -Manual. Dimensions: Overall Height - Top to Bottom: -14". Overall Width - Side to Side: -17". Overall Depth - Front to Back: -9".
feature_bullets: 12 built-in stitches including a four-step buttonhole
Stitch width adjustment and length adjustment ensures ease of use
Drop feed for free motion sewing and quilting
110-volt machine, for use in US only

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars733 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
